optimize API reference¶

Data¶

class optimize.data.CompositeDataset(label=None)¶

Bases: optimize.data.Dataset, dict

A useful class to extend for composite data sets.

Constructs a general dataset, simply stores a label for now.

Parameters

label (str) – The label for this dataset.

get_trainable(labels=None)¶

Gets the trainable dataset as a numpy array.

Raises

NotImplementedError – Must implement this method for a given subclass.

get_view(labels)¶

Returns a view into sub data objects.

Parameters

labels (str or list of strings) – The labels to get.

Returns

A view into the original data object.

Return type

type(self)

class optimize.data.Dataset(label=None)¶

Bases: object

A base class for datasets. This class is not useful to instantiate on its own.

label¶

The label for this dataset. Defaults to None.

Type

str

Constructs a general dataset, simply stores a label for now.

Parameters

label (str) – The label for this dataset.

get_apriori_errors()¶

Gets the aprior errors (likely known beforehand and provided by the user).

Raises

NotImplementedError Must implement this method. –

get_trainable(*args, **kwargs)¶

Gets the trainable dataset as a numpy array.

Raises

NotImplementedError – Must implement this method for a given subclass.

initialize(pars)¶

Called before optimization routines.

Parameters

pars (Parameters) – The parameters.

class optimize.data.HomogeneousCompositeSimpleSeries¶

Bases: optimize.data.CompositeDataset

A useful class to extend for composite 1d datasets which are all instances of SimpleSeries on the same data set.

indices¶

The indices for each dataset when sorted according to x.

Type

dict

Properties:

x (np.ndarray): The x vector. y (np.ndarray): The y vector. yerr (np.ndarray): The yerr vector.

Constructs a general dataset, simply stores a label for now.

Parameters

label (str) – The label for this dataset.

gen_indices()¶

Utility function to generate the indices of each dataset (when sorted according to x).

Returns

A dictionary with keys = data labels, values = numpy array of indices (ints).

Return type

dict

gen_label_vec()¶

Generates a vector where each index corresponds to the label of measurement x, sorted by x as well.

Returns

The label vector sorted according to self.indices.

Return type

np.ndarray

get_apriori_errors()¶

Gets the aprior errors (likely known beforehand and provided by the user).

Raises

NotImplementedError Must implement this method. –

get_trainable()¶

Gets the trainable dataset as a numpy array.

Returns

Returns self.y.

Return type

np.ndarray

get_vec(attr, sort=True, labels=None)¶

Gets a vector for certain labels and possibly sorts it.

Parameters

  • attr (str) – The attribute to get.

  • sort (bool) – Whether or not to sort the returned vector.

  • labels (list of strings, optional) – The labels to get. Defaults to all.

Returns

The vector, sorted according to x if sort=True.

Return type

np.ndarray

property n¶

The number of data points.

Returns

The number of data points.

Return type

int

property x¶

The x vector.

Returns

The sorted x vector.

Return type

np.ndarray

property y¶

The y vector.

Returns

The y vector sorted according to x.

Return type

np.ndarray

property yerr¶

The yerr vector.

Returns

The yerr vector sorted according to x.

Return type

np.ndarray

class optimize.data.SimpleSeries(x, y, yerr=None, label=None)¶

Bases: optimize.data.Dataset

A class for a 1d->1d homogeneous dataset, sorted according to x. This class may be used directly or extended.

x¶

The effective independent variable.

Type

np.ndarray

y¶

The effective dependent variable.

Type

np.ndarray

yerr¶

The intrinsic errorbars for y. Defaults to None.

Type

np.ndarray, optional

label¶

The label for this dataset. Defaults to None.

Type

str

Constructs a series dataset.

Parameters

  • x (np.ndarray) – The effective independent variable.

  • y (np.ndarray) – The effective dependent variable.

  • yerr (np.ndarray) – The intrinsic errorbars for y. Defaults to None. If not provided, one cannot use noise-based modeling.

  • label (str) – The label for this dataset. Defaults to None.

get_apriori_errors()¶

Gets the aprior errors (likely known beforehand and provided by the user).

Raises

NotImplementedError Must implement this method. –

get_trainable()¶

Gets the trainable dataset as a numpy array.

Raises

NotImplementedError – Must implement this method for a given subclass.
